repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
- `health#check()` seems to have been removed for a while, but `:h faq` still refers to it.
- `news-0.11.txt` doesn't mention #33044

Closes #32478 
Closes #32571

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3784,7 +3784,7 @@ nvim_create_autocmd({event}, {opts})                   *nvim_create_autocmd()*
                    • match: (string) <amatch> (expanded to a full path)
                    • buf: (number) <abuf>
                    • data: (any) arbitrary data passed from
-                     |nvim_exec_autocmds()|                       *event-data*

comment_data.body: this is not an improvement. the old text was better.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3773,9 +3773,9 @@ nvim_create_autocmd({event}, {opts})                   *nvim_create_autocmd()*
                  • callback (function|string) optional: Lua function (or
                    Vimscript function name, if string) called when the
                    event(s) is triggered. Lua callback can return a truthy
-                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand.
-                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:
-                                                                  *event-args*
+                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand, in
+                   addition, it also receives a table with these keys as
+                   argument:                                      *event-args*

comment_data.body:
Which old text are you implying?

this is the text before this commit
```help
                 • callback (function|string) optional: Lua function (or
                   Vimscript function name, if string) called when the
                   event(s) is triggered. Lua callback can return a truthy
                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand.
                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:
```
I think the sentence "Receives one argument" refers to any callback, which means both Lua and Vimscript callback, but that has never worked with Vimscript callback
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3773,9 +3773,9 @@ nvim_create_autocmd({event}, {opts})                   *nvim_create_autocmd()*
                  • callback (function|string) optional: Lua function (or
                    Vimscript function name, if string) called when the
                    event(s) is triggered. Lua callback can return a truthy
-                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand.
-                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:
-                                                                  *event-args*
+                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand, in
+                   addition, it also receives a table with these keys as
+                   argument:                                      *event-args*

comment_data.body: It's ok. The old text is fine for now. This block should not be changed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3773,9 +3773,9 @@ nvim_create_autocmd({event}, {opts})                   *nvim_create_autocmd()*
                  • callback (function|string) optional: Lua function (or
                    Vimscript function name, if string) called when the
                    event(s) is triggered. Lua callback can return a truthy
-                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand.
-                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:
-                                                                  *event-args*
+                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand, in
+                   addition, it also receives a table with these keys as
+                   argument:                                      *event-args*

comment_data.body: After reviewing this, it does seem like this whole section is more cost than benefit. So this is a nice simplification.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -214,56 +218,9 @@ and loads the first module found ("first wins"): >
     bar/lua/mod.so
     bar/lua/mod.dll
 <
-                                                        *lua-package-path*
-Nvim automatically adjusts |package.path| and |package.cpath| according to the
-effective 'runtimepath' value. Adjustment happens whenever 'runtimepath' is
-changed. `package.path` is adjusted by simply appending `/lua/?.lua` and
-`/lua/?/init.lua` to each directory from 'runtimepath' (`/` is actually the
-first character of `package.config`).
-
-Similarly to |package.path|, modified directories from 'runtimepath' are also
-added to |package.cpath|. In this case, instead of appending `/lua/?.lua` and
-`/lua/?/init.lua` to each runtimepath, all unique `?`-containing suffixes of
-the existing |package.cpath| are used. Example:
-
-- 1. Given that

comment_data.body: But why? Can you please explain what the sentence `"Receives one argument"` means? Since the subject of the block is `"callback"`, I think it would refers to both Lua callback and Vimscript callback. Unless you plan to fix that feature so that it also works with Vimscript callback, then I think the document of the function must be updated
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3773,9 +3773,9 @@ nvim_create_autocmd({event}, {opts})                   *nvim_create_autocmd()*
                  • callback (function|string) optional: Lua function (or
                    Vimscript function name, if string) called when the
                    event(s) is triggered. Lua callback can return a truthy
-                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand.
-                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:
-                                                                  *event-args*
+                   value (not `false` or `nil`) to delete the autocommand, in
+                   addition, it also receives a table with these keys as
+                   argument:                                      *event-args*

comment_data.body: Over-explaining every callback in this way is not something I care about. The vimscript callback really shouldn't exist at all.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

-                   Receives one argument, a table with these keys:

+                   addition, it also receives a table with these keys as
+                   argument:                                      *event-args*

comment_regular_data.body:
Backport failed for `release-0.11`, because it was unable to cherry-pick the commit(s).

Please cherry-pick the changes locally and resolve any conflicts.
```bash
git fetch origin release-0.11
git worktree add -d .worktree/backport-33183-to-release-0.11 origin/release-0.11
cd .worktree/backport-33183-to-release-0.11
git switch --create backport-33183-to-release-0.11
git cherry-pick -x 87b4469adcf2de5f792ea0d19afd002e9cb96016
```
